definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: The righteous walls are opening in our educational systems.
sentences.chinese: 在我们的教育系统中，将展开公义的墙垣。

sentences.english: Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for God's righteousness.
sentences.chinese: 饥渴爱慕神公义的人有福了。

sentences.english: There's been a death take place in their life and an impartation of righteousness.
sentences.chinese: 他们在生命中经历过死亡，并且领受了公义。

sentences.english: They rejoice in your name all day long; they exult in your righteousness.
sentences.chinese: 他们因你的名终日欢乐，因你的公义得以高举。

sentences.english: For Truth Stumbles In The Public Square, And Righteousness Cannot Enter.
sentences.chinese: 在公众大会堂中真理绊跌，且公义不得其门而入。

sentences.english: I that speak in righteousness, mighty to save.
sentences.chinese: 就是我，是凭公义说话，以大能施行拯救。

sentences.english: In the righteous kingdom of God, life is at full tide.
sentences.chinese: 在神公义的国度里，生命是处于涨潮的状态。

sentences.english: Truth springs from the earth, And righteousness looks down from heaven.
sentences.chinese: 诚实从地而生，公义从天而现。

sentences.english: With the belt of truth buckled around your waist, with the breastplate of righteousness in place.
sentences.chinese: 用真理当作带子束腰，用公义当作护心镜遮胸。

sentences.english: In thy name shall they rejoice all the day: and in thy righteousness shall they be exalted.
sentences.chinese: 他们因你的名终日欢乐，因你的公义得以高举。

sentences.english: God makes just condemnations of sin and unbelief.
sentences.chinese: 神对罪与悖逆发出公义的责难。

sentences.english: The LORD executeth righteousness and judgment for all that are oppressed.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华施行公义，为一切受屈的人伸冤。

sentences.english: Now you're asking China to play by fairness?
sentences.chinese: 现在你又要求中国的行为应符合公义？

sentences.english: All the words of my mouth are in righteousness; there is nothing froward or perverse in them.
sentences.chinese: 我口中的言语，都是公义，并无弯曲乖僻。

sentences.english: Marriage was instituted by God himself in the time of man's innocency and uprightness.
sentences.chinese: 婚姻是上帝在人无罪，圣洁公义的时候所设立的。

sentences.english: He longs for them to adjust their behaviour to reflect the righteousness of Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 他切望他们能够改正行为以彰显出耶稣的公义。

definition: trustworthy/reliable/to believe something to be true
(third person pronoun for a divine being)
Jehovah (biblical name for God, Hebrew: YHWH)/compare Yahweh 雅威[Ya3 wei1] and God 上帝[Shang4 di4]
